component.text: Click through the buttons for summary information.

• Secure communications requires integrity, authentication, and confidentiality.

  • Cryptography is related to the making and using of encryption methods.

  • Cryptanalysis is related to the solving or breaking of a cryptographic encryption method.

  • Cryptology is the combination of cryptography and cryptanalysis.

Integrity Authentication Confidentiality
Cryptographic hashes, protocols, and algorithms MD5
SHA		 HMAC-MD5
HMAC-SHA-1
RSA and DSA		 DES
3DES
AES

• Cryptographic hashes play a vital role when securing network traffic.

  • Integrity is provided by using the MD5 algorithm or the SHA-1 algorithm.

  • Authenticity is provided using HMAC.

  • Confidentiality is provided using various encryption algorithms.

• Symmetric encryption algorithms are best known as shared-secret key algorithms.
  • The usual key length is 80 - 256 bits.
  • A sender and receiver must share a secret key.
  • They are usually quite fast (wire speed) because these algorithms are based on simple mathematical operations.
  • Examples of symmetric encryption algorithms are DES, 3DES, AES, IDEA, RC2/4/5/6, and Blowfish.

• Asymmetric encryption algorithms are best known as public key algorithms.
  • The usual key length is 512â€“4096 bits.
  • A sender and receiver do not share a secret key.
  • These algorithms are relatively slow because they are based on difficult computational algorithms.
  • Examples of asymmetric encryption algorithms are RSA, ElGamal, elliptic curves, and DH.
Two separate keys which are not shared

• Encryption can be implemented using a symmetric or asymmetric algorithm.

  • Various symmetric encryption algorithms can be used. Each option varies in regard to the degree of protection and the ease of implementation.

  • Diffie-Hellman is a hashing algorithm that is used to support DES, 3DES, and AES.
Can I get your Public Key please?

1. Alice acquires Bob's public key.
2. Alice uses Bob's public key to encrypt a message using an agreed-upon algorithm.
3. Alice transmits the encrypted message to Bob.
4. Bob uses his private key to decrypt and reveal the message.

• Asymmetric encryption can use digital signatures, such as the RSA algorithm, to provide authentication and confidentiality.

  • Asymmetric encryption is usually implemented using a public key infrastructure (PKI).
